erasure noun
(OF PAST)
[ U ] the act of causing a feeling, memory, or period of time to be completely forgotten: He laments Virginia's erasure from popular history as the birthplace of English America.
[ U ] literary the act of removing or destroying something, especially something that shows that that person or thing ever existed or happened: the nuclear erasure of entire populations
